{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Calix |model=GS2020 |revision=E |series=AX6000 |fcc_date=07/25/2018 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |type=wireless router, IoT hub |fcc_id=2ABLK-GS2020 |ic_id=4009A-GS2020 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=5 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm |cpu1_model=IPQ8074 |cpu1_cspeed=2 GHz |cpu1_cores=4 |expansion_if_types=USB 3.0, |expansion_usb_num=1 |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi1_chip1_model=QCN5054 |wi1_chip2_brand=Qualcomm |wi1_chip2_model=QCN5054 |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an+ac+ax |wi1_txchains=8 |wi1_rxchains=8 |wi1_sstreams=8 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm |wi2_chip1_model=QCN5024 |wi2_802dot11_protocols=bgn+ax |wi2_txchains=4 |wi2_rxchains=4 |wi2_sstreams=4 |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |wan_ports=1 |flags=VHT80+80, HE80+80, 3.5mm audio output, |stock_os=Linux;4.4.60;;, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac+ax |default_ssid=CXNKXXXXXXXX |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin }}
:• '''1150''' Mbps - 4SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ax 802.11ax] (40MHz chan.) :• '''4800''' Mbps - 8SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ax 802.11ax] (80MHz chan.) = '''''AX6000'' class'''
Some FCC documents are reused from the [[Calix GigaSpire GS2026E]]. This device supposedly just has the Zigbee, Z-wave, Bluetooth, and voice recognition hardware removed according to the Attestation Reuse Data R1 document. The maximum transfer rate for 802.11ax is listed as 4803.9Mbps in test report documents despite claims within the same documents that 80+80MHz channel bandwidths are supported with 8TX and 8RX chains. We'll go with the 4800 Mbps speed, for now, on the assumption that this device drops down to 4x4:4 when using 80+80MHz channels since other 802.11ax devices currently seem to do so. {{FCC ST|01/20/2019}} {{WiFiCert|WFA78706|08/14/2018}} ===See also=== *[[List of 802.11ax Hardware]]
